data: Vocabulaire grec et épigraphie: ἀρχός "chef, archonte"
Olivier Masson, « Vocabulaire grec et épigraphie: ἀρχός “chef, archonte” », in O-o-pe-ro-si: Festschrift für Ernst Risch zum 75. Geburtstag, éd. par A. Etter (Berlin: Walter de Gruyter, 1986), 451‑57
Orsi suggested the text was probably originally centred on the rock, but only the right part of three lines now preserved.

Large letters, rendered somewhat crude and deep due to the coarse stone. Sigma is four-bar with slightly open upper and lower strokes; omega is large, rounded and open with short tails; alpha has straight bar; epsilon has shorter middle bar; nu has three full length strokes, first and last vertical; mu has vertical first and last, but shorter middle strokes descending only half-way; omicron is full-size; rho has fairly large rounded, closed eye.
Later 4th or 3rd century BCE on the basis of the letter forms
I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana
Orsi, 1876-, Notizie degli scavi di antichità
Guarducci, 1876-, Notizie degli scavi di antichità
Vollgraff, 1951, Inhumation en terre sacrée dans l'antiquité grecque (à propos d'une inscription d'Argos)
Manganaro, 1965, Ricerche di antichità e di epigrafia siceliote
Masson, 1986, Vocabulaire grec et épigraphie: ἀρχός "chef, archonte"

1[---]ἀρχὸς(vac.)
2[---]Δαμ(vac.)
3[---]ͱ̣ενναίων(vac.)
